alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 08 at 2:08PM AKST until March 10 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM WEDNESDAY TO 9 PM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Blowing snow reducing visibility to one half mile or less at times over highway summits north of Fairbanks. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, north of Fairbanks with 4 to 7 inches of snow are expected south of Fairbanks. * WHERE...Middle Tanana Valley. * WHEN...9 AM Wednesday to 9 PM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 40 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow over highway summits north of Fairbanks. Expect 2 to 4 inches of snow from Fairbanks north and 4 to 7 inches of snow south of Fairbanks. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow and blowing snow means periods of snow and blowing snow will cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
